articles.author: Jeff Mason, Steve Holland, Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is taking calls to step aside as the Democratic presidential candidate seriously and multiple Democratic officials think an exit is a matter of time, according to sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Once defiant, Biden is now 'soul searching' about dropping out of race

articles.author: Tim Reid, Nathan Layne, James Oliphant
articles.description: Five days after narrowly escaping assassination, Donald Trump will accept his presidential nomination on Thursday before an adoring crowd of supporters, the final act in his transformation of the Republican Party into the party of Trump.
articles.title: Republican Party is Trump's now. Critics wary his quest for power will go unchecked

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces bombarded the Gaza Strip's historic refugee camps in the centre of the enclave and struck Gaza City in the north on Thursday, killing at least 13 people, and tanks pushed deeper into Rafah in the south, health officials and residents said.
articles.title: Israel bombards central Gaza as tanks advance deeper in Rafah

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: When intelligence officials briefed Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in May ahead of a snap presidential election, their report was grim: angered by economic hardship and crackdowns on social freedoms, most Iranians planned to boycott the vote and turnout would only be about 13%.
articles.title: How Iran's Khamenei elevated a little-known moderate to the presidency

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Student protesters demanding an end to quotas for government jobs in Bangladesh called on Thursday for a complete shutdown nationwide, after deadly clashes this week killed six and injured hundreds.
articles.title: Bangladesh quota protesters call for nationwide shutdown amid clashes

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia does not rule out new deployments of nuclear missiles in response to the planned U.S. stationing of long-range conventional weapons in Germany, Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov was quoted as saying on Thursday.
articles.title: Russia says it may deploy nuclear missiles in response to US weapons in Germany

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden has begun to accept the idea that he may not be able to win the Nov. 5 election and may have to drop out of the race, the New York Times reported on Thursday, citing several people close to the president.
articles.title: Biden begins to accept he may have to drop out of race, New York Times reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's military said on Friday it had conducted a loudspeaker broadcast campaign directed at North Korea overnight in response to the launch of balloons by Pyongyang carrying trash aimed at the South.
articles.title: South Korea conducts loudspeaker broadcasts at North Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's president, Dina Boluarte, could be criminally responsible and topped the chain of command that led to dozens of deaths during protests at the beginning of her presidency, Amnesty International claims in a report released on Thursday.
articles.title: Peru's Boluarte could be criminally responsible for protest deaths, Amnesty says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will host Volodymyr Zelenskiy at a meeting of his top ministers on Friday, a show of support for the Ukrainian leader who will welcome a new plan to try to disrupt Russia's attempts to evade shipping sanctions.
articles.title: In show of support, UK's Starmer invites Ukraine's Zelenskiy to attend cabinet
